channel.title: How do I add a source?
channel.description: I'm quite new to mopar and I want to run a server for me and a few friends, I already know how to get it online but my problem is, I don't seem to know how to add a source to it so we can play it, because I really don't want to have to code my whole server, here's the source I wanted to add http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,551851.0.html It's not mine but I like the look of it, could someone help me please?

item.title: How do I add a source?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

download the source, make sure you have JRE unless you want to develop also than get JDK long with it. Inside the server folder you will see atleast 2 .bat files. 1 will be to run the server and the other will be to compile. I think run.bat is pretty much explained. Compile is to “compile” your work so you can see the changes you have made next time you run it.

Make sure the ip address is set to yours and you have port forwarded correctly(not getting into all of that) than hit run.bat. Open your client and have fun.
When connecting to yourself use the ip 127.0.0.1
for friends go to myipaddress.com

Read full topic
item.source: How do I add a source?
